statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: West Virginia 96, Seton Hall 86
article.story: MORGANTOWN, W.Va. (AP) -- Tyrone Sally tied a career high with 25 points Sunday to lead West Virginia to a 96-86 win over Seton Hall. The Mountaineers (16-8 overall, 6-7 Big East) reached their highest point total in two seasons and improved to 12-0 when scoring at least 70. Mike Gansey added 19 points for West Virginia. Kevin Pittsnogle added 16 and Joe Herber finished with 10. Donald Copeland had a career-high 19 points for Seton Hall (11-12, 3-9), which lost for the fifth time in six games despite also setting a season high in points. West Virginia took the lead for good early in the game. Sally scored 10 points over the first seven minutes and finished 9-of-14 from the floor. The Mountaineers built an 18-point lead late in the first half, but Seton Hall used a full-court press to cut the deficit to 41-32 at halftime. Seton Hall got no closer than 43-37 on a Sweet tip-in with 18:52 remaining. West Virginia pushed the lead back to 17 points midway through the second half. Pittsnogle and Herber combined for 23 of West Virginia's 55 second-half points. Seton Hall played its second game without swingman J.R. Morris, the team's third-leading scorer who was suspended earlier in the week to focus on academics. John Allen added 17 points for Seton Hall, Andre Sweet had 14 and Brian Laing 11. Leading scorer Kelly Whitney fouled out midway through the second half and finished with 10 points.<
